questions.question: What is the most common cause of hospitalization?
questions.explanation: Heart failure is the most common cause of hospitalization.

questions.question: Which drug improves survival in heart failure with reduced ejection fraction?
questions.explanation: Beta-blockers like Metoprolol improve survival in HFrEF by reducing sympathetic activity.

questions.question: Which arrhythmia is characterized by an irregularly irregular rhythm?
questions.explanation: Atrial fibrillation is characterized by an irregularly irregular heart rhythm with no P waves.

questions.question: Which organ is most commonly affected in hereditary hemochromatosis?
questions.explanation: The liver is the most commonly affected organ in hereditary hemochromatosis, leading to cirrhosis.

questions.question: What is the most common cause of acute pancreatitis?
questions.explanation: Alcohol consumption along with gallstones are the most common cause of acute pancreatitis

questions.question: Which of the following cause of acute pancreatitis is associted with hyponatremia
questions.explanation: Hypertriglyceridemia causes pseudohyponatremia by interfering with laboratory measurements in certain assays, leading to falsely low sodium levels due to plasma water displacement by excess lipids

questions.question: Which of the following is not a criteria for diagnosis of acute pancreatitis
choices: Elevated lipase level 3x upper of normal  limit
questions.explanation: Acute pancreatits is diagnosed if the patient meets 2/3 of the criteria (a) epigastric abdominal pain, (b) lipase 3 upper of normal limit, (c) imaging showing acute pancreatitis

questions.question: AAT deficiency usually involve which lobes of the lung?
choices: Doesnt affect the lung at all

questions.question: What is the primary biochemical abnormality in IPF?
questions.explanation: Wilson disease is caused by defective copper excretion, leading to toxic accumulation.
